data.description:
**PEARSON DIGITAL & TECHNOLOGY INTERNSHIP PROGRAM**


*Data Analyst Intern*


**Why join Pearson’s intern program?**


Pearson is the world’s learning company. We help people of all ages acquire the knowledge and skills they need to be successful in their work and careers. We believe that everyone should be able to keep learning, every day and in every way, throughout their lives. Bringing together everything we know about the science of learning and the latest technology; we’re shaping the future of teaching and learning.


We’re looking for the next generation of talented undergraduates to join our team for an unforgettable 10-week internship. An internship at Pearson is an opportunity to bring your own unique perspective as a learner, together with your academic knowledge, technical skills, and enthusiasm, to help create products used by students like you.


As one of our interns, you will gain a comprehensive introduction to our business. You’ll be assigned to a team and work on real-life projects that bring our qualification delivery and services to life. Support in the role in job training and professional development will be provided to enable you to contribute to the business. You’ll also have direct access to a senior member of the team, as each intern will be mentored to help you make the most of the 10-week program.


We foster a work environment that’s inclusive as well as diverse, where our people can be themselves. Every idea and perspective are valued so that our products reflect the people we serve — our teachers and learners.


**What Does the Internship Program Offer?**


Successful candidates will spend 10 weeks working both with Central Technology and Pearson Businesses.


You will be paid for the duration of your internship. The internship begins on Monday, June 2 nd and ends Friday, August 8 th .


**What do the 10 weeks involve?**


Interns will develop a broad knowledge of business analysis at Pearson, completing rotational work with several teams focused on different business and technology assessment delivery There will also be an opportunity to work and contribute to solutions management strategic initiatives.


**Job Description**


We are looking for a uniquely talented individual who can turn data into insight and action. The Data Analyst consults with internal customers to understand their business questions, and then delivers analyses to meet those needs. Along the way, instrumentation is specified and deployed, data pipelines and processing defined, and visualizations built. The end results help optimize our customer experience and inform the entire product life cycle from ideation to launch to constant improvement.


We are looking for strong critical thinking skills, the ability to navigate various data environments, hands-on technical ability in data, and a drive to understand our business. The successful candidate will be a thought partner for our customers and will assist them in understanding data and generating further questions. This individual will dig into raw and processed data (backend DBs, Google Analytics, and event/message data), transform information into visualizations using Microsoft BI, Tableau, R, Excel, etc., and effectively articulate the story behind the data. The role involves close interaction with product management, user design groups, data warehouse developers, data architects, and software development teams. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are critical.


**Responsibilities**


Partner with Product Managers, Service Owners, Engineering Leads, Data Architects and content teams to prioritize, scope and perform in-depth analyses that drive and inform strategic decisions, especially related to product development and growth initiatives.


Develop insights to answer complex questions via thorough and well-designed data analyses using SQL, R, and Microsoft BI and other tools with a focus on product efficacy and the optimization of learning outcomes.


Provide thoughtful leadership with internal stakeholders so that they may be able to better leverage insights.


Develop an in-depth knowledge of business operations, document business processes and work with stakeholders to design new processes to achieve strategic goals. Understand on a broad level how operations between different business units interact and flow together.


Lead technology team discussions concerning business requirements.


Develop an in-depth understanding of enterprise data objects and attributes. Work with business stakeholders to define functional data needs for the creation of data marts.


Work across departments and collaborate with business managers, user experience designers, systems architects, engineering delivery teams, project managers, QA, and operations teams.


Identify information and visualizations required to tell a compelling and meaningful story using data; establish baselines and monitor growth or decline in metrics.


Contribute to tools, documentation, and instruction to enable our customers to increasingly use data independently.


Track and report on the status of deliverables in a project schedule. Serve as a point of contact to our business partners and cross-functional teams for day-to-day management of the Analytics program.


**Minimum Requirements**


* We look for Students pursuing a STEM degree (computer science, software engineering, information security, engineering, or technology)
* Students should also have strong communication skills, both written and verbal, along with an ability to translate business requests into technical asks. Experience in computer software is a bonus.
* Critical thinking and flexibility is important, as you will be joining a versatile and agile solutions management team.
* Familiarity with some of the following: SQL, PL/SQL, UNIX, Excel, Microsoft BI, Tableau, Bi-Publisher, MongoDB, Java, JavaScript, C/C++, Python, PHP, HTML etc.
* Familiarity with database design and development experience using Db2, SQL Server, or Oracle databases and Structured Query Language (SQL).
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel.
* Graduation date of May 2026.
* Must be able to work hybrid; in-person/remote at our Durham office for the entire 10-weeks

*Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.*


**What to expect from Pearson**


Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022?


At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson.

data.description:
PRISM is a joint powers authority (JPA) that provides risk management and insurance solutions for public entities throughout California. Our organization is member driven meaning that our public entity members have numerous opportunities available to participate in the governance of our JPA.

  



One of PRISM’s greatest assets is its staff. PRISM employees are smart, creative, hard-working, and passionate individuals working in areas ranging from member services, risk control, claims administration, information technology, accounting, and risk pool administration. Working here requires energy, commitment, and teamwork. At the same time, we offer a great work environment built upon our Core Values of **People, Families, Trust, Integrity, and Growth**. We are looking for an individual who shares these values to join the PRISM team.

  



The Data Analyst is responsible for developing reports, dashboards, applications, and tools that provide information to PRISM staff and the PRISM membership as well as partners, brokers, and vendors. They perform financial reporting for the finance and claims departments, brokers, reinsurers, and the insurance market. They also interact with staff, member and broker representatives to determine specifications and requirements and priorities for report and product development.

  


**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

  


* Maintain and continue to develop a solid understanding of technical processes with skills in data manipulation, database access, reporting, application development, and report/application development and database software and tools.
* Collect, analyze, and interpret data and information to be included in information products covering a broad range of topics in support of both recurring and ad hoc business information needs.
* Perform monthly, semi-annual, and annual data processing, database loads, and data verification. Apply changes, corrections and overrides as needed.
* Develop and prepare reports, online dashboards, applications, and tools to pro-actively support data driven decision making; effectively researching, investigating, identifying and recommending metrics and other comparative information.
* Automate recurring reporting and/or data collection/manipulation processes.
* Insure that all production reports and information products are produced in an accurate and timely manner.
* Verify that information products reconcile with comparable reports and/or company financials, and that report content (including counts, amounts and descriptive information) are reasonable and correct.
* Track down data anomalies, financial discrepancies, and other data and information “issues” and determine the appropriate corrective course of action. Provide notification of issues as necessary.
* Work with data providers on obtaining, verifying, and mapping member loss data submissions. Update the conversion and mapping routines necessary for processing loss data (working with the database team when needed).
* Work with the members and data providers to improve the quality and timeliness of the data provided.
* Communicate with D&A customers in regards to their information and reporting needs, and develop specifications, requirements, development timelines for reports and information products.
* When needed, provide requirements to the database development team for new database components and/or modifications to existing structures and processes.
* Work on specific data and/or analytical projects as directed by their supervisor.
* Respond to ad-hoc requests for information as directed by their supervisor.
* Perform other duties as assigned by their supervisor or the department manager/director.


The ideal candidate for this position will be an energetic self-starter with the capacity to independently manage responsibilities, tasks, and goals; be creative, and capable of looking at new and different approaches to solving problems and resolving issues; and possess strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical customers and staff.



Candidates should possess:


* A bachelor’s degree in Mathematics or Statistics, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Experience in analytics, operational reporting and/or financial reconciliation may be substituted in lieu of education.
* Strong knowledge of Excel and exposure to SQL is required.
* Experience working in Python and Qlik is preferred.
* Prior experience working in risk pooling, insurance or risk management is highly desirable.

  




\*\*\* Applications will be pulled for first review on ***Thursday, October 10, 2024*** \*\*\*



In-person interviews are tentatively scheduled for the week of October 21, 2024.

  


**Physical Requirements**



This position will require reaching, fingering, grasping, talking, hearing, seeing and repetitive motions. Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects.



Some travel may be required.

  


**Licensing Requirements**



A valid Driver’s license is required. Proof of auto insurance with no exclusion for business use is required.

  



We are seeking candidates who can fulfill this position through a hybrid work model consisting of remote work and in-person work in our Folsom office. This position is required to attend in-person meetings or office events at least every other week.


A generous benefit package is provided including Public Employees Retirement System (PERS) health benefits, dental, vision, long-term disability, life insurance, PERS retirement, deferred compensation program, sick leave, vacation leave, and section 125 cafeteria benefits. PRISM employees do not pay into Social Security except for the Medicare portion of the cost.

At Zoox, our Data Governance team is responsible for setting internal standards that govern our data policies - how data is gathered, stored, processed and disposed. We're responsible for managing the integrity, usability and security of our enterprise systems. As our Enterprise Data Governance Intern, you will support ongoing and new activities (e.g. configuration management and data dictionaries), create and maintain project documentation for business process flows & management reports, share guidance and expertise with the organization, participate in various testing cycles to support the end-user and facilitate meetings and trainings as needed.
### **Technical Qualifications & Language Requirements**

+ Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's in Data Analytics, Business Analytics or related field
+ Strong foundation of data project lifecycles
+ Proficiency in Google Suites
+ Ability to communicate clearly, organize competing priorities, work under pressure, collaborate effectively and be a proactive self-starter
+ Bonus/Nice-To-Have - Previous background in automotive/transportation or consulting industries

**Compensation**
The monthly salary range for this position is **$6,500** to **$9,500**. Compensation will vary based on role, degree level and type, and benefits will be offered based on eligibility. Additional benefits may include medical insurance, 401k, and a housing stipend. **About Zoox**
Zoox is developing the first ground-up, fully autonomous vehicle fleet and the supporting ecosystem required to bring this technology to market. Sitting at the intersection of robotics, machine learning, and design, Zoox aims to provide the next generation of mobility-as-a-service in urban environments. We’re looking for top talent that shares our passion and wants to be part of a fast-moving and highly execution-oriented team.  

Follow us on LinkedIn **Accommodations**
If you need an accommodation to participate in the application or interview process please reach out to accommodations@zoox.com or your assigned recruiter. ***A Final Note:****You do not need to match every listed expectation to apply for this position. Here at Zoox, we know that diverse perspectives foster the innovation we need to be successful, and we are committed to building a team that encompasses a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.*

data.description:
Inmar's dedicated Manufacturer Settlement approach to Data Management transforms our clients strategies and visions into life. We protect and service our client's most valuable assets through the highest quality data processes helping our clients achieve their goals today and grow for the future.  

  

As a member of the Promotions Data Management Team, the Specialist will be responsible for and maintain the integrity of our databases that provide the foundation for our products; most currently this work is focused on our Client's Offer Master Files where the Specialist enters and edits offers and performs exception management.  

  

The Specialist performs validation of client barcodes prior to issuance to ensure the accuracy of the data, manages rebate claims validation as well as any follow-up research necessary and provides specialized transaction settlement support by performing duties of a routine and recurring nature. This role requires effective client communication as well as effective internal communications (both written and verbal).
Primary Accountabilities:* (80%) Administrative
	+ Perform accurate data entry
	+ Respond to coupon/rebate discrepancies
	+ Pull and collaborate retailer ads
	+ Counterfeit Reporting (Entry per list)
	+ Verification/Validation (Testing or Coupon validation)
	+ Expiration Date Grace Period changes
	+ Research Coupon Scanning Issues
	+ Administrative Projects/Changes
	+ Offer/Offer Edit (w/o CTR)
	+ QML/APEX Work Offers
	+ Create and maintain client’s divisions in rebate system (R2)
	+ Client Webportal (Alinea) Password Resets
* (20%) Analytical
	+ Validate movement data against promotion guidelines and expected results for payment
	+ Perform daily analysis on Question Mark list
	+ Ensure integrity of client database by performing database management


Additional Responsibilities:* Performs other duties as assigned
* Complies with all policies and standards


Required Qualifications:* High School Diploma/GED required
* 1-3 years related work experience or college degree; or any equivalent combination of experience and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to complete the major responsibilities/essential functions of the position required
* Accurately perform alpha/numeric data entry
* Professionally maintain great business relationships
* Organize tasks and time to ensure timely completion of all projects
* Competent with Google Suite and Microsoft Office, especially Excel
* Competent with General CPU
* Competent in Salesforce
* Beginner iSeries


Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the major job responsibilities (essential functions) of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the major job responsibilities. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with the job.* Use Hands to Handle Objects - Regularly
* Reach with Hands or Arms - Regularly
* Talk or Hear and Read Instructions - Regularly
* Stand, Kneel, or Stoop and Lift 20 Pounds - Occasionally
* View Items at a Close Range - Regularly

*Rarely*: Job requires this activity up to 25% of the time*Occasionally*: Job requires this activity between 25% - 50% of the time*Frequently*: Job requires this activity between 50% - 75% of the time*Constantly*: Job requires this activity more than 75% of the time
Individual Competencies* Teamwork: Advanced communication skills used to lead a team.
* Innovative: Arrives at decision using analytical thought.
* Analytical and Critical Thinking: Communicates using persuasion and authority.
* Problem Solving: Completes routine and repetitive tasks where tasks are straightforward.
* Collaboration: Creates internal alliances outside the immediate team or department.


As an Inmar Associate, you:* Put clients first and consistently display a positive attitude and behaviors that demonstrate an awareness and willingness to listen and respond to clients in order to meet their short-term and long-term needs, requirements and exceed their expectations.
* Treat clients and teammates with courtesy, consideration and tact; you also have the ability to perceive the needs of internal and external clients and communicate effectively with the objective of delighting and retaining the client.
* Build collaborative relationships and work cooperatively with others, inside and outside the organization, to accomplish objectives, develop and maintain mutually beneficial partnerships, leverage information and achieve results.
* Set and attain achievable, yet aggressive, goals with a sense of urgency and accountability.
* Understand that results are important and focus on turning mission into action to achieve results following the principles of Flawless Execution while consistently complying with quality, service and productivity standards to meet deadlines and exceed expectations by giving our clients the best possible outcome.
* Support a safe work environment by following safety rules and regulations and reporting all safety hazards.
